meanings.definition: A person who uses electronic communication to bully others.
meanings.sent1: The cyberbully sent mean messages to the victim online.
meanings.sent2: It is important to report any cyberbully behavior to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The cyberbully tried to hide behind their screen, but their actions were still harmful.
meanings.sent4: The cyberbully's words were like virtual punches, causing emotional pain.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cyberbully haunted the victim's online experience.

meanings.definition: To bully someone using electronic communication.
meanings.sent1: She decided to cyberbully her classmate by spreading rumors online.
meanings.sent2: Parents should educate their children about the consequences of cyberbullying.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly told him not to cyberbully them in their group chat.
meanings.sent4: His hurtful comments cyberbullied her self-esteem into a downward spiral.
meanings.sent5: The online community united to stop the cyberbully from causing more harm.
